alert.note: Alert for Briscoe; Swisher (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 28 at 6:30PM CDT until May 28 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lubbock Texas has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Swisher County in the Panhandle of Texas... Western Briscoe County in the Panhandle of Texas... * Until 730 PM CDT. * At 629 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 5 miles southwest of Vigo Park, or 12 miles east of Tulia, and is nearly stationary. Another severe thunderstorm is located just southeast of this storm and also nearly stationary. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Silverton, Vigo Park and Mackenzie Reservoir. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
